dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 26-8561]
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: The Planet Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, March 10, 2005 3:59 AM
To: gfi-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
Cc: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 26-8561]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being sent to our copyright-related legal counsel at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com for consideration.


- -------- Original Message --------
Subject: [ABUSE] Copyright Infringement Notice ID: 26-8561
Date: Wed, 9 Mar 2005 18:21:07 -0800
From: gfi-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
Reply-To: gfi-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
To: abuse@theplanet.com

Notice ID:26-8561
Notice  Date:10 Mar 2005 02:19:53 GMT
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
Re:  Unauthorized Use of GFI Software Ltd. Property Dear Sir or Madam:

GFI Software Ltd. and its affiliated companies (collectively, "GFI Software
Ltd.") are the exclusive owners of copyrights and other proprietary rights
in numerous motion picture and television properties, including but not
limited to LANguard.

It has come to our attention that ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
is the service provider for the IP address listed below, from which
unauthorized copying and distribution (downloading, uploading, file serving,
file "swapping" or other similar activities) of GFI Software Ltd.'
property(s) listed below is taking place.  We believe that the Internet
access of the user engaging in this infringement is provided by
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. or a downstream service provider who
purchases this connectivity from ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc..

This unauthorized copying and distribution constitutes copyright
infringement under Section 106 of the U.S. Copyright Act.  Depending upon
the type of service ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. is providing to
this IP address, it may have legal and/or equitable liability if it does not
expeditiously remove or disable access to the
property(s) listed below, or if it fails to implement a policy that provides
for termination of subscribers who are repeat infringers (see,
17 U.S.C.
